traceability.evidence: - src/maintenance contains implementations for detect, update, batch, verify, report functions with JSDoc @story and @req annotations. - tests/maintenance covers basic unit tests for detectStaleAnnotations, updateAnnotationReferences, batchUpdateAnnotations, verifyAnnotations, and generateMaintenanceReport, all referencing docs/stories/009.0-DEV-MAINTENANCE-TOOLS.story.md. - No CLI entry point or command-line tool implemented for maintenance operations as described (no bin script or README usage examples). - No documentation files (in docs/ or user-docs/) providing usage examples or best practices for these maintenance tools. - No tests or code addressing REQ-MAINT-SAFE reversibility beyond minimal return values, nor integration with ESLint configuration or feedback mechanisms for end users.
traceability.notes: The core helper functions and their unit tests exist (REQ-MAINT-DETECT, ‑UPDATE, ‑BATCH, ‑VERIFY, ‑REPORT), but the story’s acceptance criteria around user experience (CLI interface and clear feedback), documentation, and error-handling scenarios (circular refs, reversible operations) are unmet. Therefore the story implementation is incomplete.
